SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the association between the development of central nervous system (CNS) symptoms in patients with Behçet disease and medical therapy
PARTICIPANTS: A total of 317 patients with Behçet disease with ocular complications who visited Hokkaido University Hospital, Sapporo, Japan, between 1978 and 1994
MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES: The incidence of CNS symptoms in different medical therapies
RESULTS: Twenty-one (6.6%) of the 317 patients developed CNS symptoms, namely neuro-Behçet disease
Of the 21 patients, 12 were undergoing cyclosporine therapy
Of the 47 patients who underwent cyclosporine therapy, 12 (25.5%) developed CNS symptoms, whereas only 9 (3.3%) of 270 patients who did not undergo cyclosporine therapy developed CNS symptoms
CONCLUSIONS: Cyclosporine in the treatment of Behçet disease appears to cause neurotoxicity or to accelerate the development of CNS symptoms
Thus, neurologic complications appear to represent a major side effect of cyclosporine in the treatment of patients with Behçet disease
